bio:
Jianping Jiang is Global Postdoctoral Fellow at NYU Shanghai. He holds a PhD from University of Arizona.

Research Interests

Jiang’s research interests are probability theory and statistical physics.

Recent Publications

  • Russo's formula, uniqueness of the infinite cluster and continuous differentiability of free energy for continuum percolation (with Sanguo Zhang and Tiande Guo), Journal of Applied Probability, 48, 597-610 (2011).
  • A relationship between fixed time Wiener measures and Wiener measures with fixed endpoints, Journal of Statistical Physics, 156, 177-188 (2014).
